job_title: Full Stack Web Developer - Apple Maps POI
summary:
Apple Maps is about more than just locations and directions, it's about modeling the physical world in software. In this position you will be developing internal software involved in curating, analyzing, and correcting the data which drives the POI feature in Maps. This will include full stack development with a front-end focus. Key challenges include creating efficient workflows for data curation, optimizing database queries and modeling, and constructing views which provide insight into the complex data which makes up our POI network.


Key Qualifications
5+ years of experience in Javascript and front-end web development frameworks / technologies
Experience working with Java or newer JVM-based languages such as Scala or Clojure
Experience designing and implementing UIs for complex workflows and datasets
Ability to rapidly learn new technologies
Strong written and oral communication skills

Description
The Apple Maps POI data and engineering team is looking for a full stack web developer to join our team. We are constantly optimizing and improving our POI data pipeline while introducing new features in order to deliver the highest-quality POI experience to our customers. In this role you will build complex web applications and associated systems to model and curate public POI data. This data flows through our systems to be displayed in the Maps application. You should have experience with UI/UX design, complex databases, and data pipelines. In your role as a full stack web developer for Maps POI, you will have the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment on highly impactful projects. We are looking for developers who thrive in a small team of talented engineers working to tackle problems under tight deadline constraints and deliver imaginative solutions.


Education
- Bachelor's degree in CS or relevant industry experience

UW Bothell, Information Technologies, has an outstanding opportunity for a Web Developer – Application Development


Job Description:


Enhance Production Systems:


•Clearly define and document application requirements for requested system enhancements.


•Estimate number of hours to build a solution based on the approved design.


•Build system based on approved designs and review with lead and/or senior software engineer.


•Report work against assigned tasks.


•Complete unit testing and notify QA of readiness for integrated testing.


•Resolve defects based on feedback from the QA analyst.


•Deploy solutions upon successful completion of testing.


Support Production Systems – Internal and External Websites and Web Applications:


•Contact system users to understand any reported issues or concerns with existing production systems.


•Determine whether the reported issues are a defect or a request for enhanced functionality.


•Support and maintain systems within the established service level agreement for the applicable system.


•Design and implement appropriate fixes following established design/build standards and operational processes and procedures for the team.


Document Production Systems:


•Create documentation of assigned production systems per established documentation standards.


•Maintain documentation over time as systems are enhanced.


•Review documentation with software engineer to ensure accuracy and completeness.


Team Operational Improvements Projects:


•Collaborate with the team lead engineer and/or team manager to implement desired operational improvements based on the project plans.


Requirements:


• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Informatics, or Information Science.


• 2 - 3 years of experience analyzing, designing, developing, installing and maintaining .NET web-based applications and services.


• Experience supporting an enterprise-level web application and website with emphasis in the following:


* Developing multi-tier web applications with .NET Web Forms, .NET MVC and C#.


* Experience with HTML, CSS and JavaScript and modern web browsers.


* Developing and debugging with Microsoft Visual Studio.


* Managing data with MS SQL Server 2014+ and working with SSIS packages.


* Experience with XML, JSON and querying data from Web Services.


* Managing Internet Information Services (IIS) on Windows Server.


* Managing source code with GIT.


* Familiarity with and interest in applying accessibility standards to code.


• Experience managing a public website within a .NET Content Management System.


• Web Application development experience in a collaborative environment, practicing good code management techniques and well refined code documentation skills.


• Excellent communication skills and the ability to work well in a diverse team oriented environment.


• High level of self-initiated problem-solving skills and an ability to prioritize tasks to meet multiple deadlines.


• Strong written and verbal communication skills; strong interpersonal skills, including problem solving and consensus building.


• Excellent organizational skills, accuracy and self-motivation; and demonstrated customer service focus.
Equivalent education/experience will substitute for all minimum qualifications except when there are legal requirements, such as a license/certification/registration.


Desired:


• 1+ years’ experience supporting/managing web infrastructure in a higher education institution.


• Experience with cloud service providers like Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services.


• Working experience with Kentico Content Management System.


• Knowledge of CRM systems, Content Delivery Systems, other web application technologies.


• Application development techniques:


* Unit Testing


* Entity Framework


* Web Services (REST)


Working Conditions:

This position requires a flexible work schedule and the ability to work some evenings and/or weekends.

Appointment to this position is contingent upon obtaining satisfactory results from a criminal background check

At Wellthy, we dream of the day when taking care of the sick and the elderly becomes seamlessly human and tech powered. Wellthy is evolving the way we take care of each other. We are building a better healthcare experience for people with complex, chronic, and aging family members.

As a senior full stack web developer, you will have a large impact on the product. Joining us at this stage will offer you the opportunity to grow with the company.

You will report to the CTO and partner closely with the rest of our product team to scope and run full projects to deliver new features for the Wellthy platform.

In the first three months at Wellthy, you will:
Own entire projects from start to finish
See your code go into production on a daily basis
Gain experience at all levels of our stack
Help scale and evolve the Wellthy platform as the company grows
Make a strong contribution to the company culture and leadership team

WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:
You are an experienced developer who has built and maintained a large scale responsive web app using Django and React . Like everyone, you have your favorite technologies but you’re not dogmatic about them. In fact, you enjoy learning new technologies on a regular basis. You derive satisfaction not just from clean code and creative solutions but from producing a genuinely useful product that improves the lives of others. You are comfortable running with a project on your own but enjoy collaborating with talented and thoughtful colleagues. You realize life is short and that what you build and who you build it with matters.

Relaxed vacation policy, 2 weeks min. per year encouraged
MacBook Pro and any other office setup desired (i.e. 4K monitor)
Free snacks, happy hours and weekly team lunch
Twice weekly boot camp classes
And of course, covered access to Wellthy for your own family's care coordination needs

About Wellthy: Wellthy is a healthcare coordination service. We use dedicated care coordinators and our seamless technology platform to project manage healthcare for families with sick and aging loved ones. Wellthy takes the pain out of healthcare – scheduling appointments, finding the right specialists, researching treatment options, managing insurance, organizing records, communicating with family members and much more. We add a layer of much-needed customer service to the health system – giving families help, hope and peace of mind. Get the care you and your loved ones deserve. With a Wellthy Care Coordinator, you'll always have someone on your side.

The Full Stack Web Developer position is responsible for development of software supporting ArcherDX’s commercial software products. This includes but is not limited to: Support and development of Archer Analysis commercial software, Support and development of Archer Assay Designer commercial software, and support and development of infrastructure to support commercial software products. This is a user interface-focused position. The successful candidate will have extensive experience with Django (or a similar framework), Python, JavaScript, and be proficient with database technologies.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
As part of the commercial software team, you will be responsible for advancing existing bioinformatics pipeline UIs, visualizations, and infrastructure. This role will play a key part in advancing Archer’s software interfaces to ensure that they remain at the forefront of the industry. Qualifications

EXPERIENCE:
3+ years of professional UI development experience (preferably Django); 3+ years of Python development experience; Demonstrated ability to create data visualizations; Proficient with Javascript;
EDUCATION:
BS in Computer Science or equivalent work experience.


Additional Information

ArcherDX (archerdx.com), the NGS applications company, is developing and commercializing a novel approach to target enrichment chemistry. Next-generation sequencing technology based on Anchored Multiplexed PCR (AMP™) generates a highly enriched library of gene targets of interest for downstream genomic sequencing. Complemented by proprietary software and readily accessible reports, our technology enables dramatic enhancement in mutation detection speed as well as complex mutation identification and discovery.

We offer competitive compensation and generous benefits programs.
Unless otherwise stated, all descriptions above are preferred but not required for our ideal candidate. Consideration will be given for comparable experience. ArcherDX is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills.

We are looking for a Web Developer responsible for managing the interchange of data between the server and the users, as well as translating the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce the visual elements of the application. You will also design the overall architecture of the web application and evolve it to ensure maximum performance and stability. This will be for consumer facing web pages, external B2B portals, HIPAA compliant and PCI compliant internal and external facing web tools. We will need intranet services with full security controls and integration at the database level (ODBC,JDBC) to our EMR.
Responsibilities

Design of the overall architecture of the web application(s)
Implementation of a robust set of services and APIs to power the web application(s)
Building reusable code and libraries for future use
Optimization of the application for maximum speed and scalability

Implementation of security and data protection (HIPAA, PCI … .)
Translation of UI/UX wireframes to visual elements
Integration of the front-end and back-end aspects of the web application

Skills and Qualifications

Proficient knowledge of a back-end programming language This developer must have the knowledge of one or more: PHP, Python, Java, CSS, JavaScript etc.

Understanding differences between multiple delivery platforms (such as mobile vs, desktop), and optimizing output to match the specific platform

Good understanding of server-side templating languages such as Jade, EJS, Jinja, etc. depending on our technology stack

Good understanding of server-side CSS preprocessors such as Stylus, Less, Sass etc. depending on our technology stack

Creating database schemas that represent and support business processes

Data migration, transformation, and scripting

Management of hosting environment, including database administration and scaling an application to support load changes

Understanding of fundamental design principles behind a scalable application

Ability to implement automated testing platforms and unit tests

Good understanding and knowledge of advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks such as AngularJS, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, ReactJS, DurandalJS etc.

Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery and other frameworks such as Zepto, MooTools, etc. depending on project requirements

Basic knowledge of image authoring tools, ability to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image. Familiarity with tools such as as Gimp or Photoshop is a plus.

Proficient understanding of code versioning tools e.g. Git, Mercurial or SVN

Familiarity with development aiding tools such as Bower, Bundler, Rake, Gulp, etc. depending on the technology stack

Educational requirements are flexible based upon experience and attitude.

• Serves as a technical administrator of the web server computer system. Consults with other system administrators as necessary to ensure smooth operation of the system.

• Creates, develops, implements, and maintains the technical architecture of the university’s websites, and supports existing infrastructure.

• Serves as a consultant to University stakeholders in planning, designing, and maintaining Web site/web pages to ensure design, style, and content uniformity.

• Designs, builds, or maintains web sites, using authoring or scripting languages, content creation tools, management tools, and digital media.

• Supports the university’s goal of ensuring ADA and other regulatory compliance of the university’s website.

• In close collaboration with the Marketing Department, ensures Web pages reflect the marketing and public relations goals of the university and university branding.

• Provides training, support, and technical assistance to assigned departmental Web authors ensuring consistency across the university’s web pages.

• Designs and implements web site security measures such as firewalls or message encryption.

• Maintains existing web applications and tests web applications units and systems.

• Designs and implements user-driven templates, icons, images, databases, and interfaces that are used consistently within the website.

• Identifies and utilizes appropriate tools to track usage statistics on the university website.

• Ensures cross-browser, cross-platform pages, and DHTML compatibility.

• Recommends and implements performance improvements.

• Performs other duties as assigned.

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Graphic Art/Design, or other related field. Formal technical education and related experience may be substituted for the degree requirement

If you're a web developer who wants to make an impact, push boundaries and be more involved in the process, we hope you'll consider applying at Interactive Strategies. Our developers are not only responsible for writing and testing clean, efficient code; they are involved in all aspects of our projects and are engaged early on in the process. Therefore we’re looking for self-starters and passionate thinkers who can provide valuable ideas upfront and create elegant technical solutions – before a line of code is ever written.
Our developers also work closely with our front-end team to create dynamic user experiences using the latest frameworks and technologies, including EmberJS. Don't know Ember? No worries, we'll provide mentoring and professional development to help you learn.
At Interactive Strategies we have a culture that promotes creativity and collaboration. We do our best work when we work together, so you'll be partnered with strategists, designers, marketers and other passionate developers to deliver comprehensive and integrated solutions. We have a diverse range of clients, so the work always stays interesting. And internally, we're working on a very promising start-up idea that you'll be involved with.

Requirements:
While we value your skills as a JavaScript developer, your ability to thrive in our environment is equally important. We’re especially keen on finding a candidate with the following characteristics:

Wants to do more than just "stay current" with website development best practices.
Enjoys collaboration and brings a sense of humor.
Experiments with new technologies in new ways and is not afraid of failing or asking others for help.
Is a well-organized, team-player who thrives when juggling multiple projects and aggressive deadlines.
can explain difficult concepts in simple, non-technical terms to non-technical people, like clients.
Cares how code is written, and codes not just for efficiency, but for readability.
treats his/her code like a resume. How you write your code matters to you.
Is opinionated about how sites should function, but open-minded to new ideas.
thinks of multiple ways to achieve requirements and make development decisions based on client needs.

Your experience and expertise...
We don't necessarily care how long you've been doing development; more important is the passion and talent you bring to the table. With that said, it would be nice if you have the following experience:

You’re fully comfortable working from the command line
You write code that is clear, consistent, and easy for others to read
You test your code before you push
You are experienced working with CMS backends (i.e. Drupal, Wordpress, etc)
You can set up and configure a web server on your own
Performance and speed is something you consider when developing
You are comfortable providing accurate time estimates for completing work.

Bonus points:

You have built JS apps that rely on a third party REST or JSON API backend.
You have familiarity with Headless/Decoupled website development.
You have worked with JavaScript frameworks, like Ember or React.
You have experience with social media integrations.

Benefits:
We allow our employees creative freedom. We treat them with respect. We value their opinions. In that spirit, we offer the following benefits:

Full health and dental insurance coverage
Profit sharing
3+ weeks vacation/sick time from day one; 4+ weeks after year 3
Short-term and long-term disability
401k with employer match
3% new business referral bonus
Professional development opportunities
Flexible work schedule and 'work from home' days

The .Net Web Developer, reporting to the IT Enterprise Technology Tools department, is accountable for maintaining and enhancing development of the corporate externally facing web infrastructure. The .Net Web Developer works with the Web Architect on solutions for implementing new features, troubleshooting defects and general maintenance of the web infrastructure to current web technology standards and user expectations on ease of use and performance. The .Net Web Developer has experience with content management solutions like Umbraco and development platforms and tools Visual Studios, IIS, .NET, Javascript and other applications running on Windows platforms and how they interoperate.


Essential Job Functions:

• Work with architect, project manager, IT analysts, and occasionally with business users to develop web solutions per requirements.

• Work independently within a small team and follow through on development tasks.

• Independently troubleshoot and research challenging web related development problems

• Developing and contributing to technical documentation in Confluence

• Develop prototypes and architectures for new concepts and technologies and demonstrate to web architect, senior IT leadership and key business process owners.

• Perform implementations and support for higher and lower-level environments and other duties as assigned.

• May include deployment activities and/or operational support as determined by the team.

• Maintain understanding of current web technologies or programming practices through continuing education, reading, or participation in professional conferences, workshops, or groups.

• Maintains effective working relationships with internal personnel and external agency partners.

• Accountable for ensuring the integrity of design and development, documentation and successful deployment of external corporate and customer facing websites. Websites deployed should meet performance, budget, usability, scalability, reliability, and security needs.

• Participates in the technical design, development, testing, implementation and maintenance of website enhancements using web application servers and products such as Umbraco, IIS, .NET, Microsoft Visual Studios, Windows.

• Collaborate with other developers, business analysts and software architects to plan, design, develop, test and maintain enterprise tool solutions.

Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent working experience


Required Experience:

• 5+ years’ experience developing Microsoft platform based web solutions using .Net framework, MS SQL Server, Visual Studio, C#, VB.NET, XML, HTML, JavaScript

• Strong understanding of the software development lifecycle - must have participated on many projects through their complete lifecycles (requirements, design, development, and launch).

• A strong base of experience in many disciplines of information technology, including operating systems, systems management and development tools, application program interfaces (APIs), Google Analytics, development methodologies, Active directory services, hardware, interoperability techniques and standards.

• Hands-on Experience with Object-oriented Design (OOD)

• Experience in working with development, staging and production environments.

• Knowledge of Source Control systems like Perforce

• Knowledge of JIRA or related defect and project management tracking systems

• Experience with Agile Development, Continuous Integration, Technical Documentation

• Gaming Industry experience preferred

• Experience with custom development and Microsoft & Open Source Technology

The Front End Developer will take their passion for digital usability, design and web development to create world class experiences for Dollar Tree’s customers who interact with the brand via various digital means. The Front End Developer main role is to work with various internal and external stakeholders to capture business requirements, visions, and insights and then to transform them into scalable dynamic digital experiences The Front End Developer will collaborate with both company management as well as with external vendor partners to design and develop these digital and web applications. The Front End Developer will also play a role in developing the knowledge, understanding and underlying skill sets of any Interface Designers/Web Developers working in the Digital Division (Dollar Tree Direct) of Dollar Tree, Inc.

Responsibilities:
Provide technical Leadership for all aspects of Dollar Tree’s Ecommerce sites, Non-Ecommerce sites, Local Store Websites, Call Center application.
Serve as Primary technical contact for partners and vendors in terms of integrations, configurations, maintenance, enhancements, launches and fixes.
Play lead role in capturing requirements, issues, and enhancement requests from within the Digital division and from without (EX; HR, Finance, Merchandising) to then come up with recommended technical solutions based on those requests.
Play one of two high profile roles (Project Manager or Technical Lead) for all medium to large projects (size based on scope and complexity) which Division is charged with implementing
Accountable for making sound recommendations on the navigation, functionality, organizational structure, page-to-page flow and design of ecommerce and non-ecommerce web sites.
Translate strategy, business requirements, consumer research findings and usability/design best practices into site design solutions that balance the best user experience while delivering on business goals.
Work closely with graphic designers to create, schedule and launch various on-site and off-site promotional campaigns (i.e. Content Pages, Banner Ads, and Emails).
Work closely and collaboratively with the company’s IS department to ensure all company standards, policies and process requirements are met and maintained.

Assist in managing relationships with various technical partners & vendors as needed.
Monitor site performance across a variety of metrics (i.e. load time, up-time, performance across browsers, click through pathing, conversion, abandonment, etc.).
Perform expert reviews on concepts and wire frames and integrate this into the design process on an iterative basis by presenting the findings and suggesting changes where necessary.
Support Call Center efforts, looking for process flow improvements made possible by improving Interfaces and Work Flows.
Facilitate user sessions, present recommendations and negotiate win/win solutions with project team members.
Prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and produce quality work in a fast-paced environment.
Pin-point important issues that may require further discovery research.
Create requirements documentation for issue resolution, including gathering business requirements and detailing possible solutions.
Design user interaction solutions/schematics based on sound usability principles, research and technical feasibility. Express these solutions through design documents. These documents may include architecture-maps, system process flows and thumbnail flows.

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (EX: BS – Information Technology) plus a minimum of 8 years of interface design including site development and adaptation for established, consumer facing web sites.
5+ years of experience in the following technologies: HTML/CSS/JavaScript
A minimum of 5 years of Web programming/Computer logic experience
Experience in XML, and front end technologies (Web Developer Suite) to include Dreamweaver and Photoshop
Proven success in implementing usability testing practices and then implementing deliverables based of those outputs
A thorough and deep intellectual understanding of common web and interface conventions, as well as dynamic, data-driven web sites.
Strong understanding of various Web browser platforms (Firefox, Chrome, Safari, Internet Explorer), and the impact/variations they can have on such things as usability, load times, and renderings
A proven track record of Project Management is necessary as is the ability to play roles in multiple projects in a fast paced environment with a focus on delivery world class outputs/deliverables
Must be able to translate business strategies into conceptual diagrams, task flows, and site maps
A strong working knowledge SEO best practices as well as experience in SEO analytics
Knowledge and understanding of the importance of marketing and online branding
Detail oriented with excellent organization, analytical, technical writing and problem-solving skills.

job_title: Principal Front End Developer - Yahoo Mail
summary:
A little about Yahoo
Yahoo is an Oath brand. Oath, a subsidiary of Verizon, is a values-led company committed to building brands people love. We reach over one billion people around the world with a dynamic house of 50+ media, communication and technology brands. A global leader in digital and mobile, Oath brands are shaping the future of communication and media.
Our mission
Build brands consumers love
Build platforms customers love
Build a company talent loves
We are looking for great talent - mobile, frontend and backend software developers, UX designers, and product engineers that can contribute to the development of our exciting next-generation products. If you are excited about the overall lifecycle of a product - building, coding, testing, launching and learning, this is the place to be, because you will learn and gain hands-on experience while engaged in projects with significant impact on the success of our businesses. You are a great problem solver, the capability to work independently as well as with a team, and the willingness to learn from our leadership.
Yahoo Mail Specific
We are currently looking for a highly qualified web developer to help us build the next generation of web mail experience for Yahoo. We need a dedicated and technically strong engineer with industry knowledge to make our web application faster, easier and most attractive place for communicating with your friends and family. We're a team that is creating one of the most sophisticated client side web applications in the world, and we're constantly pushing the limits of code complexity, user experience fluidity, and raw performance.
The road ahead is exciting, and our team is moving fast. Your work will be seen and touched by millions of people, worldwide. If you believe you have what it takes to help shape our future then look no further, apply now, and get ready for the ride of your life!

BS in Computer Science (or equivalent) with 8+ year’s experience
Experience with OOP: C++, Java, C#, or similar
Strong foundation in Computer Science, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms, and software design
Deep technical knowledge of web application development with strong command of browser-side client technologies including AJAX, HTML/HTML5, CSS, and object-oriented Javascript
Expert in software development domain and principles, including design patterns, code structure, programming languages, continuous integration, and deployment architecture
Experience with javascript framework such as React, Angular, Ember and node.js
Experience with scripting languages such as PHP, Perl, Python, and/or Ruby
Experience with Web Technologies (Node, Apache, HTTP, JSON, DNS, TCP/IP)
Experience with frontend test driven development
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
You will be
Responsible for the definition, design, development and successful and timely completion of major new features in current and future products
Performing code reviews for your peers where you will be learning from and contributing to a collaborative working model
Recommending alternative approaches to solving complex problems and utilizing new technology to achieve goals
Tackling hard engineering and user experience problems and solve them in an elegant and seamless manner.
Taking ownership of features and areas of the web application that will impact millions of users.
Working with engineering team members to explore and create interesting solutions while sharing knowledge amongst the team.
Working closely with product teams, designers, and other developers to create a truly delightful user experience
Bonus points if you have
Experience developing mail application
Experience working in Unix/Linux environments
Experience with mobile web development
Experience with SCRUM or similar agile development methodology

AMDEX is a seasoned high-technology services firm specializing in Program & Portfolio Management, Data Management and Cloud Computing, Cybersecurity & Infrastructure, leveraging experience and trusted talent to solve the federal government’s most pressing business and technical challenges. Our staff is a family of professional individuals who provide services that exceeds our client's’ objectives. We value our employees and do all we can to take care of them.

Summary
As the Web Developer, develop and maintain application for the National Institutes of Health. The applications primarily manage grant workflow, report on grant status, and respond to grantee questions.

Description
Collect and validate system requirements. Use the requirements to analyze, design, and development systems. Test the systems to ensure they meet functional and quality criteria. Develop systems in the .NET and SharePoint environments.
Use technologies including .NET and SharePoint to develop and maintain application for the National Institutes of Health. The applications primarily manage grant workflow, report on grant status, and respond to grantee questions.

Report website outages, the date and time of the outage, the length of the outage, the root cause for the outage and any corrective action taken.
Report on website changes including the type of change, requested date and time and completion date and time, and any problems that occurred.

5 or more years of experience developing systems in the .Net and SharePoint environments.
Experience working in an Agile software development environment.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field.

Job Summary

The Front-End Web Developer combines the art of design with the art of programming. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to production code to produce visual elements of the responsive web and mobile solutions. The Front-End Web Developer will work with the UI/UX designer and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works.

The ideal candidate is an expert on front-end development and is comfortable working with everything from Javascript to disciplines of UX that affect SEO including Information Architecture, Interaction Design and Visual Design. In this role, the candidate will work closely with a cross-functional product team including Marketing, Operations, and Engineering to develop applications that drive exceptional experience for KinderCare families. A strong sense of initiative and collaboration is therefore essential.


Key responsibilities include:
Provide input and feedback on creative concepts and requirements, as it relates to technical feasibility
influence and innovate creative solutions, serving as technical SME
Make recommendations on how software features and functionality can best be utilized by the end-user
Evaluate requirements and initial mock-ups, make technology recommendations that support optimal construction, maintenance, and performance Propose product enhancements and the adoption of new features,
Provide solutions in line with approved design specifications and business requirements
Create proof of concept prototypes to help with evaluating an array of solutions
Provide estimates for development work to include analysis, programming, testing and deploying
Provide appropriate feedback on the status of project work or problem resolution
Provide technical leadership, direction, and design expertise to user-interface development teams;
Lead development lifecycle with a focus on developing UI for new features and functionalities for large-scale enterprise software solutions, encompassing service layers, integration, user interfaces and data
Create sophisticated, imaginative, and efficient reusable software solutions for large-scale systems, across multiple browsers for various devices and operating systems
Technically document software deliverables through use cases, design documents, and technical specifications
Assess new issues and take ownership of establishing protocol for problem resolution
Applies problem-solving skills to provide customer support to resolve escalations
Keep open and continuous communications with Product Owners and other members of team with regard to workload and project challenges
Actively engages with members of cross-functional, product-focused teams to build a variety of features
Guides technical decisions related to front-end development and SEO best practices
Develop new user-facing features
Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs
Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability
Build reusable code and libraries for future use
Assure that all user input is validated before submitting to back-end
Develops and maintains software following the Scale Agile Framework methodology
Assists with estimation and prioritization of development efforts
Provides mentoring to other developers through regular code review
Ensures our web application is usable and consistent across many platforms and devices
Analyze software problems and provide solutions to those problems
Provides other ad hoc support and duties as assigned

Qualifications

Key desired skills and experience include:
Bachelor Degree in Computer Science with 8-years of industry experience
Master Degree in Computer Science with 5-years of industry experience
In lieu of degree, 10 years of industry experience
Proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3
Basic understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms
Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery
Good understanding of JavaScript libraries and frameworks, such as AngularJS, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, ReactJS, DurandalJS etc.
Integration of front-end technologies (such as HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, including JQuery, NodeJS, React Native and other API related technologies (JSON, REST) into functional applications.
Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX
Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them.

Experience researching, experimenting with and applying new technologies and methodologies.

Familiarity with W3C compliance and responsive viewing
Knowledge of popular social media APIs such as Facebook, Twitter, Google
Ability to research, effectively communicate and collaborate across groups
Pro-active problem-solving abilities
A motivated, self-starter
Culturally-aware aware of wider communications/marketing trends and culture as a whole
Position requires a high degree of adaptability. Incumbent will be faced with a variety of issues on a day to day basis and will be expected to respond to these issues appropriately while dealing with multiple priorities and task assignments.

Do you have the skills and passion to build what no one has built before? Do you love to challenge yourself and those around you to do the very best work? Proficient in C#; familiarity with MVC

Experience with Microsoft SQL Server
Excellent communication skills

Experience with frameworks like AngularJS, Bootstrap, Foundation
Agency experience

We work hard here, so we take our fun seriously. As a Boston Interactive team member, not only will you contribute to amazing projects and build a worthwhile career, you'll also enjoy the benefits that turn a simple job into a passion.

Overview:
Listrak is seeking an energetic, driven Programmer / Web Developer!

The Programmer/Web Developer will create, modify, and extend applications to support Listrak Professional Services and Listrak’s E-Commerce clients. Ongoing maintenance and support will be required for all applications that the Programmer/Developer works on.

The Programmer/Web Developer is also responsible for verification of client data deliveries, troubleshooting and debugging client installation of standard Listrak solutions and developing documentation and installation guides. The Programmer/Web Developer will also be a technical resource for both internal and external clients, providing integration and development assistance to client technical point persons.

Successful candidates will enjoy the “detective” aspect of the position: determining what went wrong with a process and how to rectify it. The ideal candidate must be able to work in a fast paced, changing environment and maintain a high level of professionalism, courtesy, and ethics.

Responsibilities:

Develop custom applications to bridge the standard Listrak solutions to unique client requirements.
Develop web applications including preference centers and data export/uploads.
Troubleshoot, verify and repair client code installations based upon Listrak’s integration guides.
Troubleshoot, verify and on occasion expand Listrak’s pre-packaged modules to ensure successful integration with client’s E-Commerce platform (Magento, Demandware, Miva, ASPDNSF and others.)
Troubleshoot and verify client automated data deliveries.
Prepare requirements, specifications, business processes/flows, recommendations and project estimates.
Document all work in SalesForce.
Perform other duties as assigned by the VP of Listrak Professional Services.

Qualifications:

Exposure, ability to work in .NET (preferably C#), JavaScript, MS SQL.
Ability to successfully work on multiple projects.
Advanced problem solving and creative thinking ability.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Must be self-directed when necessary but able to work in a team-environment
Working knowledge of CSS and HTML.
Ability to develop and troubleshoot PHP a plus.

Legend tells of a HTML/CSS/JavaScript Ninja, skilled enough to build flawless user interfaces from scratch. Wielding the power to convert online window shoppers into fanatical customers. Unencumbered by WordPress templates or Bootstrap. Are you the Ninja the legends speak of? If so, we summon you.


Sweetwater is searching for an experienced Front-end developer to help us build our expanding online retail empire. You will join an amazingly creative team of developers using state-of-the-art tools and technology to develop the custom codebase for Sweetwater.com.


You will help update and maintain our current code as well as designing, developing, and enhancing the UI and UX of Sweetwater.com. Additionally, you'll contribute to the continuous expansion of our reusable component and pattern libraries, as well as bring your own unique views and ideas to the table. Our team is united to give customers an amazing experience through every aspect of the website. Together we seek out innovative web experiences and industry revolutionizing ideas.

Solid mastery of HTML and CSS, without shortcuts like Bootstrap, Foundation or pre-built WordPress templates

Understanding of the roles of UI and UX in design and development

Familiarity with PHP and MVC development patterns

Experience with version control systems such as git

A background in designing and developing for eCommerce


We function best as a unified team, so relocation to our headquarters in Fort Wayne is required. As with all positions at Sweetwater, working from home is not an option. Please fill out this online application and send example URLs to jordan_applegate@sweetwater.com . (P.S. We'd love to see your GitHub account!)

The NYC Department of Design and Construction, Division of Program Management, Information Technology Services (ITS) Unit seeks a Web Developer. Under the guidance of a Lead Project Manager and System Architect, the selected candidate will be responsible participating in and managing the design, coding and improving of agency web pages, programs/applications utilizing current, best in class, techniques, and/or approaches. The Web Developer (Full Stack) will work closely with design, data, and technology teamsmembers to enhance and expand our current portfolio of applications and create new systems and services. S/he will work closely with the System Architect and the Project Manager to manage junior level resources, review requirements and provide work effort estimations. The Web Developers responsibilities will include: management of junior level and consultant resources tasked with building dynamic, responsive web-based applications including informational sites, transactional applications, and dashboards; collaborating with design team members on prototyping and user testing; understanding business and policy needs and helping translate those needs to a technology solution; working with REST Application Processing Interfaces (APIs) and web services; project management, including developing and maintaining project plans and other documents, managing, and coordinating project elements, reviewing agency and interagency work products, and ensuring efficient progress on implementation; coordinating development efforts with internal and vendor teams; and, identification and assessment of operational improvement opportunities.


Minimum Qual Requirements


Professional/Vendor Certification, Education and Experience Requirements: You must have current professional/vendor certifications. 
In addition, you must have one of the following: 
1. A masters degree in computer science or a related field from an accredited college or university, accredited by regional, national, professional, or specialized agencies recognized as accrediting bodies by the U.S. Secretary of Education and by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) AND 12 months of satisfactory full-time (not classroom based) specialized experience in computer applications development planning, design, configuration, installation, troubleshooting, integration, performance monitoring, maintenance, enhancement, and security management as described in the following nine Major Task Groups in the IT Titles Task Inventory*: Applications Development; Web Development, Design, and Maintenance; Business/Systems Analysis; Project Management Support; Application Design; GIS Structures, Spatial Analysis, and Mapping Principles; Testing; Technical Writing; and Version Control; OR 
2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university, accredited by regional, national, professional, or specialized agencies recognized as accrediting bodies by the U.S. Secretary of Education and by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) AND 24 months of satisfactory full-time (not classroom based) specialized experience as described in ?1? above; OR 
3. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State?s Department of Education or a recognized accrediting organization AND 24 months of satisfactory full-time (not classroom based) specialized experience as described in ?1? above plus 48 months of information technology experience as described in the IT Task Inventory *; OR 
4. A satisfactory combination of education and experience which is equivalent to ?3? above. Education may be substituted for the information technology experience on the basis of 30 semester credits from an accredited college or university, accredited by regional, national, professional, or specialized agencies recognized as accrediting bodies by the U.S. Secretary of Education and by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) is equivalent to 12 months of experience, up to a maximum of 48 months. However, if you qualify under options ?2,? ?3? or ?4,? you must have at least a four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State?s Department of Education or a recognized accrediting organization and at least 24 months of satisfactory full-time (not classroom based) specialized information technology experience as described in ?1? above.


Preferred Skills


The selected candidate must have strong supervisory and development skills and the ability to transform complex requirements to applications that are human-centered and easy to navigate, as-well-as, display an ability to communicate and work in a team setting. Preference will be given to candidates with experience with the following: at least three (3) years with hands on experience working with .NET Technologies (C#, ASP.NET, MVC, WebForms, WebAPI, WCF Services, Windows Services, LINQ, Asynchronous / Multithreaded Programming, Visual Studio.NET 2015, Team Foundation Services); AJAX, HTML 5, CSS and JavaScript along with frameworks such as JQuery, Bootstrap, and/or AngularJS; Microsoft SQL Server, creating data definitions, SSIS packages and complex database objects; MCSD or MCP or MCSE or MCITP: Web Applications preferred; Microsoft Visual Studio.NET, Microsoft SQL Management Studio, Microsoft Reporting Services, and Team Foundation Server; and, development of complex ETL data transformations using SSIS and stored procedures.

For all other applicants, please go to www.nyc.gov/jobs, go to Search for Open NYC Jobs and click on Non-Employee Login to search for Job ID #317127.

Great Company Culture. Utah Business , Deseret News, Salt Lake Tribune , & Entrepreneur - Best Companies to Work For and the Sloan Award for Business Excellence in Workplace Effectiveness and Flexibility.

Welcome to Planet. We believe in using space to help life on Earth.

Planet designs, builds, and operates the largest constellation of imaging satellites in history. This constellation delivers an unprecedented dataset of empirical information via a revolutionary cloud-based platform to decision-makers in commercial, environmental, and humanitarian sectors. We are both a space company and data company all rolled into one.

Customers and users across the globe use Planet's data and machine learning-powered analytics to develop new technologies, drive revenue, power research, and solve our world’s toughest challenges.

As we control every component of hardware design, manufacturing, data processing, and software engineering, our office is a truly inspiring mix of experts from a variety of domains.

We have a people-centric approach toward culture and community and we are iterating in a way that puts our team members first and prepares our company for growth.

Join Planet and be a part of our mission to change the way people see the world.

The Role:
With Planet’s continued growth and leadership in the geospatial data revolution, we are now looking for a full time front end web developer to ensure that the Planet website is the go-to resource for high quality images, analysis, and access to our core product line.

You’re a front-end developer looking to build a state-of-the art of data visualization tools for storytelling with Planet high-frequency satellite imagery and derived data products. You’re looking for an opportunity to open-source a visualization framework to empower and democratize digital storytelling for journalists, human rights activists, data scientists, and GIS analysts. In this role you’ll define the stack and product roadmap for a suite of open-source tools for data storytelling with geospatial information.

The Responsibilities:

Work closely with the Marketing, Product, and Engineering teams
Develop and productize data storytelling tools
Communicate and establish clear product scope and goals for data app development
Define and build interactive visualizations for web

The Must Haves:

At a minimum 4 years experience developing scalable web applications
JavaScript (ES6, NodeJS, React)
Web mapping Technologies (Leaflet, OpenLayers, MapboxGL, deck.gl)
Deep Understanding of Data Visualization Libraries (d3, Luma)

The Nice To Haves:

WebGL (deck.gl, Three.js)
Familiarity with GCP
Experience in Rasterio / Fiona
Design sensibility

Natural Resources Defense Council (NRDC) is the nation's most effective environmental action group, combining the power of more than two million members and online activists with the expertise of nearly 500 scientists, lawyers, policy advocates, and other professionals across the globe ensure the rights of all people to the air, the water, and the wild. NRDC was founded in 1970 and our staff helped write some of America's bedrock environmental laws, including the Clean Water Act, and many of the implementing regulations; our water enforcement cases played a major role shaping current water policy throughout the country. Today, our staff – a force for nature - work out of offices in New York, Washington DC, Chicago, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Bozeman, Montana and Beijing.

Position Summary:

NRDC is seeking a front-end web developer with a strong design background to join our digital team. This is a one year position working alongside our in-house teams (and contractors, as necessary) to create web products that align with NRDC’s strategic mission, and will take an active role in determining how those web products look and function. The ideal candidate should love working in a face-paced environment with multiple projects in progress at once.

Note: This is a one year term-limited position

Collaborate with in-house design, editorial, and web colleagues, as well as with outside vendors to transform UX wireframes into code
Assist in technical implementation strategies and creating implementation plans
Design and build engaging advocacy and fundraising forms and campaign pages
Assist in the design and delivery of standalone campaign websites/microsites
Assist the web team to diagnose and resolve bugs as needed, and to prepare for our regular site deployments

Qualifications
Proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5 and CSS.
Familiarity with PHP, Rails and Django
Experience working in Drupal, WordPress and other CMS platforms
Proficient understanding of JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery. (Understanding of advanced JavaScript frameworks such as AngularJS and KnockoutJS is a plus.)
Basic understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as SASS
Working knowledge of Git and command line tools
Familiarity with Jira, Assembla, or similar project management platforms
Familiarity with ActionKIt or a similar CRM platform strongly preferred
Experience working in-house and/or on a product team is a plus
A curiosity and willingness to master new technologies and concepts
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively across teams and projects
Strong communications skills especially with multiple stakeholders
Ability to meet deadlines while working on multiple projects
A good sense of humor and the willingness to experiment and innovate.

Jacobs Technology is the advanced technology division of Jacobs Engineering, one of the nation's largest engineering and technical services-only companies. Jacobs is the world’s top supplier of automotive test facilities, providing a full range of services to commercial automotive industry customers. Customers include not only the world’s major vehicle providers and other original equipment manufacturers (OEMs), but also clients from the international motorsports community Our experience encompasses virtually every type of automotive test facility, including climatic and driveability wind tunnels; aerodynamic, acoustic, and thermodynamic wind tunnels; emissions test rooms; soak rooms; altitude chambers; engine and powertrain test cells; and electromagnetic anechoic chambers. We not only design and build these facility systems assets but also operate, maintain, and manage these facilities.


As a programmer / web developer you would provide programming support in the development of online systems to improve the efficiency of managerial tasks and the organization of data within a test laboratory environment. You would be responsible for delivering and supporting information technology services by developing, testing, implementing, and maintaining web-based application systems. Application uptime is maximized through continuous monitoring of potential failure modes and feedback from end users. Participation with colleagues to troubleshoot reported web-based application problems and issues is required. Tasked with looking for ways to improve existing applications (i.e. decreasing application load/computing times, integrate new functionality, etc.) and develop new applications that perform tasks which previously were performed manually. They apply knowledge in a variety of client and server side programming languages (i.e. JavaScript, SQL, PHP, etc.) to produce efficient web interfaces for a variety of users - technicians, engineers, and managers. Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. A wide degree of creativity, resourcefulness, self-motivation, and versatility is required.


The online systems are constantly being evolved to improve computing times and increase user-friendly aspects by incorporate newly released features. Most of these features are used via jQuery plug-ins and custom user interfaces aimed at optimizing monitor screen space and displaying only the information the user needs to see to accomplish their specific objective.

Apogee 401(k)
Apogee offers a 401(k) plan to all our employees. You are eligible to participate in the plan beginning on the first of the month following 3 months of employment. You may contribute up to 20% of your gross wages each pay period on a pre-tax basis. Apogee will match 100% of your contribution to the 401(k) up to 7% of your gross salary. The maximum dollar amount you can contribute for 2017, per the IRS, is $18,000. The Vesting period for Apogee matching contributions is 3 years. The Apogee 401(k) is administered by Fidelity Investments. Fidelity provides Apogee 401(k) plan users a wide selection of investment choices including index funds, managed funds, stocks and bonds tailored for your investments goals and years till retirement. The goal of the Apogee Retirement Plan is to help you maximize annual retirement growth and savings while providing you the flexibility to meet other personal financial goals.

Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us.
Job Highlights
Do you love a good pull request? MITRE IT's Web Development department is looking for a full stack web developer who loves what they do and wants to put their passion to good use helping us develop and improve our web applications.
In this role, you will work with product owners and a team of developers to develop and maintain custom web applications for MITRE employees. You will be working in all the layers of the web application stack: front end application development, web services development, database interactions, and everywhere in between. There are also opportunities to expand your skills in mobile application development, data science, and machine learning as we define our future architectures.
Best of all, you will work with talented people, learn a lot, and get to introduce new ideas and concepts to an open-minded team.
Key Functions
Write easy to read, maintainable, testable code in JavaScript (Node.js as well as client-side), Python, and a number of other technologies
Work closely with other developers, designers, testers and project leads in a supportive working environment.
Lead and execute on medium to large size software application projects. You will play multiple roles in getting new projects off the ground from shaping stories to testing.
Enhance and maintain existing applications written in a variety of languages and frameworks

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications
BS
Required Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in computer science, mathematics, or a related degree OR 3+ years’ experience working with production web applications.
1+ year of hands-on development of production web applications. Preferably in JavaScript/Node.js, Java, C# or Python. We write a lot of JavaScript and Python, but we know a strong developer is a strong developer in almost any language.
Task management skills and a proactive communicator. You'll be responsible for executing on medium to large sized projects.
Desire and ability to learn new technologies
Working knowledge of the Linux command line.
Experience with modern software methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Kanban, etc.).
Working knowledge of Source Control systems (Git and/or Subversion), Database Systems (Oracle and MongoDB are a plus), build/deploy/Continuous Integration systems (Bamboo, Jenkins, etc.), and unit testing concepts and frameworks.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with Node.js (or the desire to learn it). We use it for many of our application back-ends.
Experience with Python and/or Java
Experience with Vue.js or AngularJS.
Experience with mobile development - iOS, Android, responsive or progressive web apps.
Experience with Docker is a plus. We are using it in production for our apps.
Experience with Machine Learning technologies/algorithms

We'd like you to know that "fit" is the most important criteria for us when hiring. We can always find good technical individuals, but finding ones who share our values is absolutely critical. For us, and for you! When folks share values, they look forward to coming to work and spending time with their co-workers in delivering solutions for our customers. To “fit” at WorkWave you must be:
Intellectually Curious and Passionate: You love figuring out what the problem is and finding a way to fix it. You enjoy coming to work each day and have a positive energy that the organization can see and feel.
Empathetic and Respectful: You truly appreciate other’s perspectives. You put yourself in others shoes and go out of your way to ensure that all perspectives are heard and understood before decisions are taken
Team Player: You’re willing to jump in and help whenever and wherever needed by the team. Your goal is to find ways to provide value rather than call attention to your individual performance
Get Things Done: Once you’ve determined the key elements of the problem, you solve it and figure out how to most effectively put that solution in place. You’re not afraid to roll up your sleeves, take responsibility and make things happen as an individual contributor but also know how to drive your team to do the same. Once you start them, you like to finish things, not just “checking the box” but making sure that they get done and done right.
Willing to Make Mistakes and Intellectually Honest When You Do: You are not afraid to make mistakes and, when you do, you admit them, learn from them and ensure they don’t get repeated in the future. Placing blame and spending time pointing fingers is not part of your DNA.

Why work for WorkWave?

Voted one of the Best Places to Work in New Jersey, WorkWave is unique in that it has a large, established base of loyal customers but also has enormous growth opportunities in multiple areas. We are transforming the field service industry, one customer at a time, by building intuitive, best in class cloud-based software, mobile apps and high-value services that solve key pain points our customers face every day, allowing them to save money, save time and improve customer service levels, all at the same time. To do this, we focus on 3 simple things: (1) Hiring and developing great people, (2) Building great products quickly and (3) Turning customers and employees into raving fans. We’re looking for individuals that are passionate about and can help us deliver on those 3 simple (but hard to achieve) tenets.

Work here...Wave hello to a job you’ll love! This position is based at our home office in the historic Bell Works complex located in Holmdel Township, New Jersey.
We offer a robust benefits package, including health and dental, paid time off, a 401k with company match and a great environment filled with energetic, fun, team oriented people. Most importantly, at WorkWave, there IS such a thing as free lunch. By bringing in lunch from local businesses Monday through Thursday for our entire NJ staff, we support local business and offer a great perk, all at the same time. On Fridays we encourage employees to take advantage of the hour lunch break away from their desks and explore what the Bell Works “Metro-Burb” has to offer!

• Act as lead developer for the Geneseo Drupal content management system. This includes design, development, testing, support, consulting, and administration for Drupal content. Provide daily administration for Drupal including monitoring and resolving problems, administering access to websites, backup/recovery, providing customization where applicable, web analytic support, search engine management and optimization, database maintenance, upgrades and patches, and performance tuning

• Provide input for guidelines and standards to the Web Development Team, policymakers, and other content providers

• Evaluate and recommend tools and techniques for web design, development, production, and accessibility

• Work as a member of the Information Systems team on the development of new applications and modifications to existing applications as needed

• Develop, maintain and monitor the www.geneseo.edu upper-level web pages

• Analyze, design, program, test, and support custom web applications and services

• Develop and maintain documentation for procedures and applications

• Design and implement web pages and entire websites

• Consult with customers on business process improvements, new product design, etc.

• Manage projects and customer work requests independently. This includes planning, scheduling, regular communication, and effective use of campus issue/request tracking system

• Provide training and consulting services to campus web content editors

• Provide backup support, administration, and programming for the campus portal infrastructure and applications

• Assist in providing support for the myGeneseo campus web portal. Provide user support for issues. Assist with software development for enhancements and defects as needed

• Assist in training and supervision of student employees

• Participate on CIT project teams where expertise is required

• Maintain expertise in CIT supported web technologies, like HTML / XML , JavaScript, PHP , CSS , Drupal, W3C accessibility guidelines and mandates

• Attend SUNY and vendor training seminars where appropriate


Work occasional weekends and evenings.


Salary: $50’s to mid $60’s and commensurate with experience.


Required Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field

• Demonstrated proficiency designing and implementing websites and web-based applications using HTML , CSS , JavaScript, PHP , and SQL

• Demonstrated proficiency translating graphic designs into working websites

• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

• Ability to independently manage and complete assigned projects

• Demonstrated commitment to fostering a diverse and inclusive working environment

• Available to work weekends and evenings on an occasional basis


Preferred Qualifications

• Demonstrated proficiency developing websites using the Drupal web content management system

• Demonstrated proficiency deploying websites on Apache Web server

• Demonstrated proficiency using UNIX and Linux operating systems

• Knowledge of web accessibility standards

• Professional experience in a higher education IT environment

About SUNY Geneseo

SUNY Geneseo is highly selective and is consistently rated among the top public universities in the north by U.S. News & World Report. Located in the national historic landmark village of Geneseo, the residential campus overlooks the picturesque Genesee Valley, just 30 miles south of the major metropolitan area of Rochester and 70 miles east of Buffalo. SUNY Geneseo is a member of the Council of Public Liberal Arts Colleges, a national alliance of leading liberal arts colleges in the public sector. http://www.geneseo.edu/

Job Duties/Responsibilities


Job Duties/Responsibilities


Job Duty/ Responsibility

Function 1:


-Act as lead developer for the Geneseo Drupal content management systems.

-Provide design, development, testing, support, consulting, and administration for Drupal content.

-Provide daily administration for Drupal including monitoring and resolving problems, administering access to websites, backup/recovery, providing customizations where applicable, web analytics support, search engine management and optimization, database maintenance, upgrades and patches, and performance tuning.

-Provide input for guidelines and standards to the Web Development Team, policy makers, and other content providers.

-Evaluate and recommend tools and techniques for web design, development, production and accessibility.

-Work as a member of the Information Systems team on development of new applications and modifications to existing applications as needed.

-Assist in training and supervision of student workers.


Job Duty/ Responsibility

Function 2:


-Develop, maintain and monitor the www.geneseo.edu upper level web pages.

-Analyze, design, program, test, and support custom web applications and services.

-Develop and maintain documentation for procedures and applications.

-Design and implement web pages and entire web sites.


Job Duty/ Responsibility

Function 3:


-Consult with customers on business process improvements, new product design, to keep them informed and answer questions.

-Manage projects and customer work requests independently. This includes planning, scheduling, regular communication, and effective use of campus issue/request tracking system.

-Discuss web content development options with representatives of requesting department, develop specifications and a time frame for implementation, and review all aspects with the Assistant Director for Information Systems during each phase of the process.

-Provide training and consulting services to campus web content editors.


Job Duty/ Responsibility

Function 4: Manage projects (typically managing self, sometimes coordinating small team of peers).


-Provide assistance/direction as needed to Computing & Information Technology staff and temporary service programmers.

-Work with the other Web Developer in support of current web applications and in testing of new applications.


Job Duty/ Responsibility

Function 5:


-Provide backup support, administration, and programming for the campus portal infrastructure and applications.

-Assist in providing support for the myGeneseo campus web portal. Provide user support for issues. Assist with software development for enhancements and defects as needed.


Job Duty/ Responsibility

Function 6: Professional Development.


-Maintain expertise on CIT supported web technologies, like HTML / XML , JavaScript, PHP , CSS , Drupal, W3C accessibility guidelines and mandates.

-Attend SUNY and vendor training seminars where appropriate.


Job Duty/ Responsibility

Function 7: General Requirements and Teams.


-Follow CIT Policy and Procedures as defined by the Director and CIT Management Team. These include but are not limited to attending monthly CIT department meetings and regularly scheduled functional area meetings, posting time off to CIT department calendar, completing time off and travel requests, etc.

-Perform incidental duties associated with day-to-day functions of the offices of Computing & Information Technology, most of which entail front-line interaction with campus computer users, both in person and by telephone. These tasks include [but are not limited to] resolving computing

problems for walk-in users, answering the telephone and taking messages, covering for staff absences and completing purchase requisitions.

-Post, in a timely manner, to the status web page any scheduled changes and down times, outages and problems when appropriate.

-Contribute to publication of technical and informational newsletters, electronic communications, bulletins and CIT web pages where appropriate.

-Contribute to instruction of training courses for campus computing users and staff where appropriate.

-Communicate regularly with colleagues and clients to keep them informed of activities and projects that interest or affect them. Report regularly to the Director and your area manager on the status of on-going projects.

-Be conscious of CIT’s reputation on campus and work to improve it by effective communication, knowledgeable technical support and offering new services when appropriate.

-Actively participate in CIT strategic planning and assessment processes.

-Participate when requested on CIT Project Teams where your expertise is required and/or you have the opportunity to acquire new and relevant skills. Project Team participation may comprise a significant portion of your workload during the life of a given project, and may include specific duties not outlined in this job description. The Director in consultation with other team members will evaluate your work on Project Teams.

At Mass Markets’ we believe our culture is critical to our success as we continue to grow. It goes beyond recruiting and is bigger than any one person. Description
Do you want to write code and build a product that is used by millions across the country? Then you should be a part of one of the fast growing technology companies in the country. Our systems utilize a variety of platforms including web and windows based technologies. Join us at Paycom and use your coding experience to solve unique and challenging problems and find out what it’s like to take your career to the next level!
Position Purpose
Provide high-paced software development for both internal and external projects where strong verbal and written communications skills are necessary. External projects will integrate our products and services with outside entities (vendors, clients, and other third parties). Most projects will need utilize strong organizational skills along with payroll, accounting, or benefit industry knowledge.
Software developers will work in a team environment to support and extend Paycom’s list of product offerings. In doing so, they may be exposed to multiple areas of software development and computing such as:
Web Software Development
Windows Software Development
Database design and SQL
Component technologies (ex. COM, EJB, etc.)
Integration and exchange protocols (ex. XML, Soap, etc.)
RESPONSIBILITIES
Software development of variety projects ranging from industry-wide services to client-specific reports resulting in EDI (Electronic Data Interchange) and other interfacing technologies.
Collaborate with team of developers, production support, customer support, clients, and vendors on software projects of all sizes.
Will need to work in close communication with outside entities (clients, vendors, and third parties) as though they are teammates in any project.
Perform the quality assurance and integration testing for projects after development is completed and before projects are deployed.
Manage and track communications with client/vendor, being primary project contact for some projects.
Adhere to the organizational processes and the tracking of project metrics, including financials and projects statuses.
Regular attendance as required
Performs other duties as assigned
Qualifications
Education/Certification:
A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field
Experience Required:
Must have prior experience using at least 3 other software development tools and architectures. Must show multi-programming language capabilities in job history. OR
Some experience in payroll, financial, benefits, or banking software.
Business familiarity with 401(k) plans, income deferrals, and payroll taxes.
Experience in Supply Chain and Business Application systems (ERP) and terminology.
Skills and Abilities:
Demonstrated SQL programming and/or database experience. Ability to integrate multiple databases.
Very strong communication and organizational skills with strong attention to both detail and process.
Demonstrated skills with project management tools and methodologies, software development lifecycle, and problem solving.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple concurrent projects. Ability to meet stated customer initiated deadlines.
Ability to demonstrate thorough business accounting understanding, specifically general ledger transactions.

The Turner Story
Turner is a division of Time Warner along with our sister companies, HBO and Warner Bros. We are better known as the folks who bring you CNN, HLN, TCM, TNT, TBS, Adult Swim, Cartoon Network, Turner Sports and so much more! We create premium content and deliver exceptional experiences to fans whenever and wherever they consume content. These efforts are fueled by data-driven insights and industry-leading technology. From cutting-edge breaking news stories, up-to-the-minute sports coverage, and the characters we grew up loving on to the shows we love today, Turner continues to be the gold standard in first class television programming and a demonstrated leader in digital content. We tell the stories the world wants to hear. Won’t you be a part of our story? http://www.turner.com/

What part will you play?
Adult Swim is a late night television network with a growing digital presence. We make TV shows of course, but we also build websites, mobile apps (Android, iOS) and television streaming apps (FireTV, Roku, Apple TV) to complement, promote and one day replace those traditional format shows. We're expanding our services more and more each year with a focus on original, streaming content and digital interaction with our audiences. We're looking for creative people with interesting and ambitious ideas, a strong work ethic, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, very unconventional environment.

What will you be doing?
Adult Swim is seeking an experienced Full Stack Web Developer, with an emphasis on the Front End side of the stack. Applicant should be proficient with complex applications built with modern frameworks and libraries such as React, Angular or Vue (etc.). You'd be working alongside a small team of developers. This team is part of a larger production group that runs AdultSwim.com focusing on our streaming content (http://www.adultswim.com/streams/) across platforms and the shows we produce live and in-house. Despite a (mostly) laid-back attitude, we operate in a fast-paced environment with deployments almost every day. We expect high-quality results in the areas of development and production. Creative minds are a big plus; and you're expected to contribute by pushing for modern web practices and technologies wherever possible. Attention to detail regarding your coding is a must.

What do we require from you?
3+ years' experience with web development and a deep understanding of the modern web development ecosystem
Expert level knowledge of modern front-end Javascript (ES6)
Experience with CSS3/LESS or SASS for responsive interfaces
Strong knowledge of backend technologies (web APIs, micro services, caching systems, database designs)
2+ years' experience with a SPA framework such as React, Angular or Vue
Experience with build tools such as Gulp or Webpack
Knowledge of NoSQL Databases (CouchDB or MongoDB) and optimum ways of interfacing with them through various APIs
Advanced Git knowledge and experience using it on team projects
Basic Linux command line knowledge

But wait, there’s more!
Paid time off every year to volunteer.
